new_generated_rule_explanation: The rule 'advice_argNames_consistency_check' checks all classes and their methods. If a method has an @AspectJ annotation, it retrieves the 'argNames' attribute from the annotation. If the 'argNames' attribute is not empty, it asserts that there exists a parameter name in the method's parameter names that matches the 'argNames' attribute. If the assertion fails, it generates a message indicating that the 'argNames' attribute does not correspond to the actual method parameter name.
